issue.title: Release gazebo 2.1.0 as gazebo on saucy

content.raw:
I'd suggest that for each Ubuntu Distro you plan to support 2 versions of Gazebo. One which is the stable one and one which is the new release. Note that this will grow to supporting potentially 4-5 versions simultaneously depending on how often you release due to the LTS cycles.  

We talked about this a bunch in the context of ROS: http://wiki.ros.org/Distributions/Timeline  If you expect a major version each year this will be a very close analogy.  

The choice on naming for each distro is subjective.  You could simply do gazebo and gazebo-current for each one representing N and N+1 where N is the latest stable release if you do not expect to support side by side installations. If there's a major API change gazeboX should be considered to force packagers to update their dependencies(and hopefully fix the broken code).
